title: Is it normal to enjoy a supposed traumatic experience? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well…. No… I guess it depends on the specific traumatic experience though. Assuming that it’s “supposed” by the majority to be a traumatic experience, and that majority also avoids situations like that due to feeling it as unpleasant, then it’s not normal if you enjoy it. Normal is considered something that the majority engages in, or in this case what the majority finds traumatic; this doesn’t mean that it’s healthy or good, just that it’s normal. Being a philosopher, I really want to dive into what normal really is, because in my opinion “most” people engage in certain things that I find repulsive and harmful, but I will leave it at that.
